definition[0]: a part where one or more pieces of string, rope, cloth etc have been tied or twisted together
example[0]: Are you any good at tying knots?
example[1]: Thread the string through the hoop and tie it in a knot.
definition[1]: a part where hair, a thread etc has become accidentally twisted together
example[2]: I can’t get the knots out of my hair.
example[3]: There’s a knot in my shoelace.
definition[2]: a hair style in which your hair is arranged in a tight round shape on top of your head
definition[3]: a hard round place in a piece of wood where a branch once joined the tree
definition[4]: a unit for measuring the speed of ships and aircraft, equal to about 1,853 metres per hour
definition[5]: a small group of people standing close together
example[4]: Knots of delegates stood around outside the conference centre.
definition[6]: a tight uncomfortable feeling caused by a strong emotion such as fear or anger

definition[7]: a tight painful place in a muscle

example[8]: He tried to untie the knot in the rope around his ankles.

example[12]: A pretty scarf was loosely knotted around her neck.
definition[9]: if hair, a thread etc knots, it becomes twisted together
definition[10]: if a muscle or other part of your body knots, or is knotted, it feels tight and uncomfortable
